arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings as Earthy double secures 2-1 win vs Boro
arts.sum: Having suggested he was keen to add more goals to his game earlier this month, he couldn't have come much closer to scoring his second in City colours. Bristol City Live is now on WhatsApp and we want you to join our community.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough moment that sums up their fortune as Michael Carrick rues pivotal decision
arts.sum: MicMichael Carrick rued what he called a bad decision to give Bristol City a free-kick which led to their winning goal, saying it sums up their fortune right now. "The second goal, the free-kick they get is just the totally wrong decision and the situation we're in, we need things to go our way to give us a bit of a leg-up.

arts.ttl: Super-sub Earthy scores twice as Bristol City fight back to beat Boro
arts.sum: Substitute George Earthy netted a 10-minute second-half double as Bristol City came from behind to leap into the Championship play-off spots with a thrilling 2-1 victory over Middlesbrough at Ashton Gate.

arts.ttl: Super sub George Earthy bags brace as Bristol City fight back to beat Boro
arts.sum: The West Ham loanee fired in from Cam Pring’s cross after 72 minutes and then tapped home the winner, eight minutes from time.

arts.ttl: Bristol City predicted team vs Middlesbrough as Liam Manning contends with Ross McCrorie blow
arts.sum: While there are numerous aspects of this team that are hard to predict given the injuries Bristol City have picked up in recent weeks, we are as sure as we can be that Max O'Leary will again continue between the posts. Tanner has been working on the attacking side of his game this term so can provide an outlet from the right flank and his defensive ability will allow him to start deeper as a pseudo right-back if the Robins decide to roll into a 4-4-2 as they did against Cardiff last weekend.

arts.ttl: Bristol City's impressive home form and the weakness Middlesbrough could look to expose
arts.sum: Liam Manning's Bristol City, meanwhile have leapfrogged Boro in the table and currently sit eighth heading into the game at Ashton Gate. Liam Manning has tended to utilise a 3-4-2-1 formation in recent weeks with Scott Twine and Anis Mehmeti typically deployed as two attacking midfielders behind a sole striker.

arts.ttl: Nahki Wells: Bristol City striker on Cardiff sucker punch, Conway return and Boro 'six-pointer'
arts.sum: "Having been out there for the last 15, or 20 minutes of the game, it didn't feel like we were going to concede but it has been a reoccurring factor," explained the 34-year-old explained. Although the Reds are currently the closest they have ever been to the play-offs in the Bermudian's time at Ashton Gate, the last week or so has brought with it an all-too-familiar feeling for supporters and players alike.

arts.ttl: Ross McCrorie eyed for Crystal Palace transfer as Scotland star's stunning numbers blow Premier League scouts away
arts.sum: McCrorie has impressed in the English Championship and could land a move to the Premier League

arts.ttl: “Supper happy with step I took” – Attacker on his move to Middlesbrough, ‘delighted’ with treatment from fans
arts.sum: Kike García is pleased to have had a spell at Middlesbrough earlier in this career. The 35-year-old has been with Deportivo Alavés since 2023 and spoke to AS to review his long career. García was at Middlesbrough between 2014 and 2016 when Aitor Karanka was in charge at the club. arts.ttl: 'Affects you mentally' - Tommy Conway reveals Middlesbrough dressing room view on Michael Carrick - Teesside Live
arts.sum: “I think I speak on behalf of everyone in the changing room and club, we know results haven't gone our way and we fully understand the frustration of the fans,” he said of that social media post. Tommy Conway believes he speaks on behalf of every Middlesbrough player when he says everyone is working hard to improve results - and that they are behind manager Michael Carrick.
